nodes.bodyText: Don't we need to specify spark version here?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -236,6 +236,9 @@ if [[ $confirmation = "y" ]]; then
     ./gradlew ":runners:flink:${ver}:job-server-container:dockerPush" -Pdocker-tag="${RELEASE}_rc${RC_NUM}"
   done
 
+  echo '-------------Generating and Pushing Spark job server image-------------'
+  ./gradlew "./gradlew :runners:spark:job-server:container:dockerPush" -Pdocker-tag="${RELEASE}_rc${RC_NUM}"

nodes.bodyText: No, the Spark runner only supports one Spark version per Beam release (currently 2.4.5), unlike Flink, which supports the latest three Flink versions.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -236,6 +236,9 @@ if [[ $confirmation = "y" ]]; then
     ./gradlew ":runners:flink:${ver}:job-server-container:dockerPush" -Pdocker-tag="${RELEASE}_rc${RC_NUM}"
   done
 
+  echo '-------------Generating and Pushing Spark job server image-------------'
+  ./gradlew "./gradlew :runners:spark:job-server:container:dockerPush" -Pdocker-tag="${RELEASE}_rc${RC_NUM}"

nodes.bodyText: How about in future? In addition, I think users should know which spark version is supported even if only one version is supported.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -236,6 +236,9 @@ if [[ $confirmation = "y" ]]; then
     ./gradlew ":runners:flink:${ver}:job-server-container:dockerPush" -Pdocker-tag="${RELEASE}_rc${RC_NUM}"
   done
 
+  echo '-------------Generating and Pushing Spark job server image-------------'
+  ./gradlew "./gradlew :runners:spark:job-server:container:dockerPush" -Pdocker-tag="${RELEASE}_rc${RC_NUM}"

nodes.bodyText:
Minor clarification to the above: Beam Spark runner supports Spark's latest feature release, i.e. 2.4.*.
I think the plan is to create a separate module when moving to Spark 3 (BEAM-9282). @iemejia knows more
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -236,6 +236,9 @@ if [[ $confirmation = "y" ]]; then
     ./gradlew ":runners:flink:${ver}:job-server-container:dockerPush" -Pdocker-tag="${RELEASE}_rc${RC_NUM}"
   done
 
+  echo '-------------Generating and Pushing Spark job server image-------------'
+  ./gradlew "./gradlew :runners:spark:job-server:container:dockerPush" -Pdocker-tag="${RELEASE}_rc${RC_NUM}"

nodes.bodyText: Then let’s add it to documentation some where. If I am a spark user, I would really wonder which version is being supported.
